p: By its very nature, prestige is exclusive, typically shared selectively with kin or offspring to increase fitness [ 13, 19]. This is particularly true for medicinal knowledge in Solomon Islands, the area where this study takes place [ 51]. As a result of this restricted sharing, we predict that there will be fewer knowledge sharing relationships (called edges) in the observed network than in a random network of the same size (Hypothesis 1a, Fig 1).
